churn.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if your stomach churns, you feel sick because you are nervous or frightened
churn.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: My stomach was churning on the day of the exam.
churn.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if water, mud etc churns, or if something churns it, it moves about violently
churn.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if a machine, engine, wheel etc churns, it or its parts begin to move
churn.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I pressed the gas pedal, and slowly the wheels began to churn.
churn.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to make milk by using a churn
churn.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a container used for shaking milk in order to make it into butter
churn.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a large metal container used to carry milk in
churn.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: the number of people who stop buying or using a companyâ€™s products or services during a particular period
churn.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the number of customers who stop buying a service from a supplier in a particular period of time, either because they stop using the service or because they change to another supplier
churn.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: ISP churn rates average 4% to 8% a month.
